description: Core Food Safety Management System (FSMS) requirements applicable across all Module 1 submodules

rules.fsms_001: Management must demonstrate commitment to food safety through documented policy, resource allocation, and regular review of food safety performance.
rules.fsms_002: Food safety objectives must be established, measurable, and reviewed at defined intervals with evidence of progress tracking.
rules.fsms_003: Roles, responsibilities, and authorities for food safety management must be defined, documented, and communicated to all relevant personnel.
rules.fsms_004: Competency requirements must be established for all positions affecting food safety, with documented evidence of training and qualification.
rules.fsms_005: Document control procedures must ensure only current, approved versions of documents are available at points of use.
rules.fsms_006: Records must be legible, identifiable, retrievable, protected from damage, and retained for defined periods (minimum 2 years or as required by regulation).
rules.fsms_007: Internal audits must be conducted at planned intervals covering all aspects of the food safety management system.
rules.fsms_008: Corrective actions must include investigation of root cause, implementation of corrections, verification of effectiveness, and documentation of all steps.
rules.fsms_009: Preventive actions must be taken to eliminate causes of potential non-conformances based on trend analysis and risk assessment.
rules.fsms_010: Management review must be conducted at defined intervals with documented evidence of decisions and actions taken.
rules.fsms_011: Communication processes must ensure food safety information flows effectively between all levels and functions within the organization.
rules.fsms_012: Emergency preparedness and response procedures must be established, tested annually through mock exercises, and updated based on lessons learned.
